definition: lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
pottery container for water, wine etc
variant of 甕|瓮[weng4]
surname Weng
variant of 甕|瓮[weng4]/earthen jar/urn
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
freshwater soft-shelled turtle
variant of 鱉|鳖[bie1]

sentences.english: We bottled the enemy up like turtles in a jar.
sentences.chinese: 我们把敌人围困得象瓮中之鳖。

sentences.english: Radicals of the Yellow Scarves Rebellion were packed together like turtles in a jar and appeared to be in great disarray.
sentences.chinese: 眼看宛城被围，黄巾军如瓮中之鳖一样，军心大乱。

definition: lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
to walk right into the trap
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
live target/target (of criticism etc)
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
inescapable net (idiom)/trap/dragnet
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
a fish at the bottom of the pot (idiom)/in a desperate situation
to besiege
lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
to be taken prisoner
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
